summary: Law 3 emphasizes the power of deception and the importance of keeping your true intentions hidden. By misleading others through decoys and red herrings, you can manipulate situations to your advantage. Historical examples illustrate how figures like Ninon de Lenclos and Otto von Bismarck artfully concealed their goals, leaving others unprepared for their true actions. The law argues that honesty can be detrimental, while a carefully cultivated façade can grant power and influence. Ultimately, the ability to disguise your intentions makes you formidable and unassailable.

slides.section_body: To secure your power, never reveal your true intentions. By keeping others in the dark, you maintain control over their perceptions and reactions. This unpredictability can render them defenseless against your actions.
slides.quote: Keep people off-balance and in the dark by never revealing the purpose behind your actions.

slides.section_body: Use decoyed objects of desire to distract and mislead. By giving your target something to focus on, you can more easily maneuver them into your desired outcome without them realizing.
slides.quote: Throw them off the scent by dragging red herrings across the path.

slides.section_title: The Lesson of Ninon de Lenclos
slides.section_body: Ninon’s mentorship of the young Marquis de Sevigné highlights how confusion and jealousy can be instrumental in seduction. A carefully planned deception can lead to the desired emotional response.
slides.quote: Her moves pushed the countess into confusion, ensuring successful seduction.

slides.section_body: When caught in dangerous political tides, Bismarck feigned opposition to war, concealing his true ambition. This displayed mastery in navigating complex dynamics through strategic deception.
slides.quote: No one suspected what he was up to in this case.

slides.section_body: People naturally trust appearances, making it easy to manipulate their perceptions. Use this to your advantage by creating facades that evoke trust while hiding your true intentions.
slides.quote: Our first instinct is to always trust appearances.

slides.section_body: Develop a smoke screen that distracts from your real purpose. The more familiar and harmless the front, the less likely others are to see the cunning tactics at work behind it.
slides.quote: A bland exterior—like the unreadable poker face—is often the perfect smoke screen.

slides.section_body: Establish patterns that elicit predictable responses. By conditioning your target to expect certain actions, you can manipulate them into making beneficial choices for you.
slides.quote: Expect the opposite of what you are really doing.

slides.section_body: Noble gestures can mislead others into believing in your sincerity. By appearing virtuous, you can further mask your hidden intentions while winning favor.
slides.quote: A helpful or apparently honest gesture, or one that implies the other person’s superiority—these are perfect diversionary devices.

slides.section_body: As a master of deception, accept your reputation instead of hiding it. This honesty about cunning can enhance your image and keep manipulation effective.
slides.quote: It is better to own up, to appear the honest rogue.

slides.section_body: Concealment in power dynamics allows you to navigate conflicts without detection. The most effective strategies remain unseen, ensuring you always have the upper hand.
slides.quote: It takes patience and humility to dull your brilliant colors.
